snippet: The United Methodist Church at its convention voted against changing language in its book of laws and doctrines that calls homosexuality “incompatible with Christian teaching.”
abstract: United Methodist Church votes at its convention in Tampa, Fla, against changing long-contested language in its book of laws and doctrines that calls homosexuality 'incompatible with Christian teaching'; delegates also defeat a compromise proposed by gay rights advocates that would allow Methodists to openly differ with the doctrine.
lead_paragraph: The United Methodist Church at its convention voted against changing language in its book of laws and doctrines that calls homosexuality “incompatible with Christian teaching.”

headline.seo: Methodists Vote Against Homosexuality Rule Change
